00003 /**
00004  * @brief HTML textarea class.
00005  * 
00006  * This class is used to generate teaxareas.
00007  * 
00008  * @class       Boo_Html_Textarea
00009  * @license     http://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-3.0.txt GNU General Public License
00010  * @link        http://code.ramaboo.com/ Boo Framework
00011  * @copyright   2009 David Singer
00012  * @author      David Singer <david@ramaboo.com>
00013  * @version     2.0.1
00014  */
00015 
00016 class Boo_Html_Textarea extends Boo_Html_FormControl {
00017     
00018     /**
00019      * @brief Default constructor.
00020      * @return void.
00021      */
00022     public function __construct() {
00023         parent::__construct('textarea');
00024     }
00025     
00026     /**
00027      * @brief Extends parent method.
00028      * @see Boo_Html::htmlOpen().
00029      * @return string Opening HTML tag for the element.
00030      */
00031     public function htmlOpen() {
00032         if ($this->isSticky()) {
00033             // input is sticky
00034             $name = $this->getAttr('name');
00035             
00036             // check to make sure the name attribute is set
00037             if (!$name) {
00038                 // name is not set
00039                 trigger_error('Attribute name is required for sticky inputs', E_USER_WARNING);
00040                 return false;
00041             }
00042             $postValue = htmlentities(_post($name), ENT_NOQUOTES, 'UTF-8');
00043             
00044             if ($postValue) {
00045                 // post is set so we will use that
00046                 $this->setContent($postValue);
00047             } else {
00048                 // no default value
00049             }
00050             
00051         } else {
00052             // not sticky
00053         }
00054         
00055         return parent::htmlOpen();
00056     }
00057 }
